newsitem.title: FRANCE: Alcatel - No comment on Thomson news.
newsitem.headline: Alcatel - No comment on Thomson news.

text.p: Alcatel Alsthom declined on Wednesday to comment on the French government's decision to suspend the privatisation process for electronics group Thomson SA.

The government said in October that it favoured a bid from Lagardere Groupe for Thomson over a rival offer from Alcatel but broke off the process on Wednesday after an independent privatisation commission failed to agree with its choice.
An Alcatel spokesman said the group had no comment. "We're taking note," he told Reuters.

Alcatel chairman Serge Tchuruk last week told a parliamentary committee his group was ready to present a new offer for Thomson if the Lagardere purchase fell through, according to minutes of the meeting.

The Finance Ministry said in a statement that the privatisation commission concluded that it was incapable of approving the Lagardere bid because of the terms of Lagardere's proposal to sell the consumer electronics division, Thomson Multimedia (TMM), to Korea's Daewoo Electronics.
Alcatel has said it would not have sold control of TMM, one of the world's leading television makers, to a foreign group.
